title: Amid Jan. 6 Revelations, Election Lies Still Dominate the G.O.P.
type: The hearings have demolished the myth of a stolen presidential election, but with the 2022 primary season in full tilt, the revelations have not loosened the grip of the lie on Republicans.

title: A Day After a Portrait of Pence in Danger, Trump Attacks Him Again
type: In a speech, Donald J. Trump was undeterred by the Jan. 6 House committee’s account of how his rioting supporters menaced the vice president, and the panel’s dismantling of many of his election lies.

title: The Biggest Surprises of the Jan. 6 Hearings So Far
type: Maggie Haberman breaks down the House select committee’s first two weeks of public testimony.

title: Trump’s Shadow Looms Over Fading Iran Nuclear Talks
type: With no compromise in sight and Iran making steady progress toward nuclear capability, the Biden administration could soon face a stark choice.

title: Mark Shields, TV Pundit Known for His Sharp Wit, Dies at 85
type: A former campaign strategist, he became a fixture in American political journalism and punditry and was seen on “PBS NewsHour” for 33 years.

title: Trump’s Shadow Looms Over Fading Iran Nuclear Talks
type: With no compromise in sight and Iran making steady progress toward nuclear capability, the Biden administration could soon face a stark choice.

type: The hearings have demolished the myth of a stolen presidential election, but with the 2022 primary season in full tilt, the revelations have not loosened the grip of the lie on Republicans.

title: With Funding Stalled, Chip Makers Warn Congress the U.S. Is Lagging
type: American semiconductor giants are pressing Congress to pass legislation that would provide $52 billion for their industry, warning that they may otherwise relocate overseas.

title: The Biggest Surprises of the Jan. 6 Hearings So Far
type: Maggie Haberman breaks down the House select committee’s first two weeks of public testimony.

title: A Day After a Portrait of Pence in Danger, Trump Attacks Him Again
type: In a speech, Donald J. Trump was undeterred by the Jan. 6 House committee’s account of how his rioting supporters menaced the vice president, and the panel’s dismantling of many of his election lies.

title: Michigan’s Chaotic G.O.P. Primary for Governor: ‘It’s a Circus’
type: Taking back the governor’s office in Michigan would be a huge prize for Republicans — but first, they have to get through a messy primary race.

title: A man who threatened Colorado’s secretary of state on Instagram faces two years in prison.
type: A guilty plea from a Nebraska man was the first conviction from a Justice Department task force created to combat the intimidation of election officials.

title: Jan. 6 Panel Could Start Sharing Transcripts With Justice Dept. as Soon as July
type: Congressional Democrats, under pressure from federal prosecutors, say they will begin sharing interviews after their series of public hearings concludes.

title: Covid Vaccine and Fisheries Deals Close a ‘Roller Coaster’ W.T.O. Meeting
type: Members of the global trade group were forced to scale back plans for more ambitious agreements, but they were ultimately able to reach several deals at a meeting in Geneva.
